ingredients.description: Standard all-purpose wheat flour for general baking
ingredients.notes: Store in airtight container. 10-12% protein content.

ingredients.description: High-protein flour for bread and pizza dough
ingredients.notes: 12-14% protein content. Develops more gluten.
7-9% protein content. Substitute: 1 cup AP flour minus 2 tbsp plus 2 tbsp cornstarch.

ingredients.description: Medium-protein flour for pie crusts and pastries
ingredients.notes: 8-10% protein content. Between AP and cake flour.
Contains bran and germ. Store refrigerated for freshness.

ingredients.description: All-purpose flour with leavening and salt added
ingredients.notes: Contains baking powder and salt. Do not add additional leavening.
Gluten-free. Store refrigerated. Different from almond meal.
Gluten-free. Very absorbent - use 1/4 to 1/3 the amount of regular flour.

ingredients.description: Gluten-free flour blend for general baking
ingredients.notes: Results vary by brand. Bob's Red Mill or King Arthur recommended.
Traditional for biscuits and Southern cakes. White Lily brand typical.
About 14 whole crackers = 1 cup crumbs. HoneyMaid or similar.

ingredients.description: Standard white cane or beet sugar
ingredients.notes: Basic baking sugar. Store in airtight container.
Pack firmly when measuring. Store with bread slice to keep soft.

ingredients.description: White sugar with more molasses than light brown
ingredients.notes: Stronger molasses flavor. Pack firmly when measuring.

ingredients.description: Finely ground sugar with cornstarch added
ingredients.notes: Sift before measuring for accuracy. Also called confectioners or icing sugar.
Dissolves quickly. Good for meringues. Can make from regular sugar in food processor.

ingredients.description: Partially refined sugar with large crystals
ingredients.notes: Good for topping baked goods. Sugar in the Raw brand common.

ingredients.description: Unrefined cane sugar with natural molasses
ingredients.notes: Very moist with strong molasses flavor. British baking staple.
Penzeys or homemade by storing sugar with vanilla beans.
Measures 1:1 with sugar. May have cooling effect.
Standard for baking - allows control of salt. 4 sticks = 1 lb = 2 cups.

ingredients.description: Sweet cream butter with salt added
ingredients.notes: Reduce recipe salt by 1/4 tsp per stick if substituting for unsalted.
Kerrygold, Plugra, or President brands. Superior for pastry and buttercream.
Crisco or similar. Creates tender, flaky texture. Shelf stable.
Traditional for pie crusts and biscuits. Leaf lard is highest quality.
Good for moist cakes and deep frying. Wesson or similar.
Good for baking. Lower saturated fat than other oils.

ingredients.description: Solid coconut fat, refined or virgin
ingredients.notes: Solid at room temp. Virgin has coconut flavor, refined is neutral.
Light olive oil for baking. Extra-virgin for flavor-forward recipes.

ingredients.description: Clear corn syrup for candy and baking
ingredients.notes: Karo brand. Prevents crystallization in candy. Not high-fructose corn syrup.
Karo brand. Stronger flavor than light. Traditional for pecan pie.
Clover honey is mild. Warm to liquefy if crystallized. Reduces browning temp.
Grade A Dark Amber for baking. Not pancake syrup. Refrigerate after opening.

ingredients.description: Grandma's or Brer Rabbit full-flavor molasses
ingredients.notes: Standard for gingerbread and molasses cookies.
Very strong, slightly bitter. High in iron. Use sparingly.
Lyle's brand. Essential for British baking. Similar to light corn syrup.
Sweeter than sugar. Light or dark varieties available.
Dave's Coffee Syrup or Autocrat. For coffee milk and baking.
Hershey's or similar. Acidic - use with baking soda.
Penzeys, Droste, or Valrhona. Neutral pH - use with baking powder.
King Arthur or Wincrest. Oreo-like flavor. Blend with Dutch for best results.
Guittard brand. Unique reddish color and flavor profile.
Penzeys Natural High Fat. Richer flavor and smoother texture.
Store refrigerated or frozen. Toast to enhance flavor.
Store refrigerated or frozen. Toast before using.
Blanched or natural. Toast to enhance flavor.
Good for decorating. Toast carefully - burn easily.
Toast and rub in towel to remove skins. Trader Joe's has good roasted.
Unsalted for baking. Roasted or raw. Beautiful green color.
Unsalted for baking. High fat content, very rich.
Baker's Angel Flake or similar. Standard for most baking.
Bob's Red Mill or bulk. Better for recipes controlling sugar.
For topping and decoration. Toast to golden brown.
Sunmaid or similar. Plump in warm water if dry.
Milder flavor than dark raisins. Good in lighter baked goods.
Smaller and tangier than raisins. For scones and British baking.
Ocean Spray or Trader Joe's. Good in cookies and breads.
Tart (Montmorency) or sweet (Bing). Premium dried fruit.
Dice finely for cookies. Strong flavor - use sparingly.
Less sweet than crystallized. Chewy texture.
Turkish or California. Chop for baking.
Premium dates. Remove pits before using. Natural sweetener.
Crush for intense flavor. No moisture to affect baking.
Crush for frosting or fillings. Intense berry flavor.
Use whole or crushed. Won't bleed into batter.

ingredients.description: Pure vanilla extract from vanilla beans
ingredients.notes: Mexican or Madagascar vanilla. Costco has good value. Never imitation.

ingredients.description: Vanilla extract with vanilla bean seeds
ingredients.notes: Nielsen-Massey or Heilala. Shows vanilla specks. 1:1 for extract.
Very potent - use sparingly. Pure is bitter almond oil based.
Different from mint extract. For candy canes, holiday baking.
Milder than peppermint. For mint chocolate recipes.
Concentrated lemon flavor. Good when fresh zest unavailable.
Concentrated orange flavor. Complement with zest for depth.
Concentrated maple flavor. Use with real maple syrup.
Non-alcoholic rum flavor. Good substitute when avoiding alcohol.
Concentrated coconut flavor. Use with coconut for depth.
Adds coffee flavor without liquid. Trablit or similar.
Enhances chocolate flavor. Use with cocoa and chocolate.
Intense raspberry flavor for chocolates and frostings.
Vietnamese (Saigon) is strongest. Indonesian Korintje is classic.
For mulled cider, poaching. Ceylon is mild, Cassia is stronger.
Freshly grated whole nutmeg has best flavor. Use sparingly.
Grate fresh with microplane. Far superior to pre-ground.
Tastes like cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves combined. Jamaican is best.
Very potent - use sparingly. Essential for gingerbread.
For studding hams, mulled drinks. Remove before serving.
Different flavor than fresh. Essential for gingerbread and cookies.
Aromatic, slightly citrusy. Essential for Scandinavian baking.
Similar to nutmeg but more delicate. Traditional in pound cakes.
For lemon poppy seed recipes. Store refrigerated - go rancid.
Stabilizes egg whites. With baking soda makes baking powder.

ingredients.description: Blend of star anise, cloves, cinnamon, Sichuan pepper, fennel
ingredients.notes: Penzeys. Adds complexity to chocolate and Asian-inspired baking.
Use sparingly - can be soapy. Good with lemon and honey.
Madagascar Bourbon or Tahitian. Split and scrape seeds.
Morton's. More dense than kosher - use less if substituting.
Diamond Crystal or Morton's (different weights). Easier to pinch.
Maldon brand. For topping baked goods - visual and textural.
Nestl√©, Ghirardelli, or Guittard. Standard for chocolate chip cookies.
Sweeter than semi-sweet. Ghirardelli milk chips are good.
Ghirardelli 60% or Guittard Extra Dark. More intense flavor.
Ghirardelli or Guittard. Not technically chocolate (no cocoa solids).
For pancakes, delicate cookies. Nestl√© or Ghirardelli.
Nestl√©. For blondies, oatmeal cookies.
Reese's brand. Good with chocolate in cookies.
Hershey's. For snickerdoodles, apple recipes.
Nestl√©. Enhances chocolate flavor.
Heath or Skor bits. For cookies, brownies, cakes.
Baker's, Ghirardelli, or Guittard. For brownies, ganache.
Baker's or Ghirardelli. Pure chocolate liquor, no sugar.
Callebaut, Valrhona, or Guittard. High cocoa butter for tempering.
Callebaut or Guittard. For coating and molding.
Guittard Cr√®me Fran√ßais. Real cocoa butter based.
Callebaut Ruby. Natural berry-like flavor, pink color.
Wilton or Ghirardelli. No tempering needed. Various colors.
Kraft or Brach's. Unwrap and melt for caramel apples, sauce.
Kraken, Myers's, or Gosling's. For rum balls, fruitcake.
Bacardi or similar. Lighter flavor than dark.
Bacardi Gold. Medium flavor between white and dark.
For pecan pie, bourbon balls. Maker's Mark or similar.
Jameson or Bushmills. For Irish cream, coffee cake.
Premium orange liqueur. For chocolate, crepe suzette.
Cointreau is premium version. For citrus desserts.
DiSaronno. For almond desserts, tiramisu variation.
For hazelnut desserts, coffee drinks, chocolate pairings.
Premium raspberry liqueur. For chocolate-raspberry desserts.
For tiramisu, coffee desserts, chocolate enhancement.
For Black Forest cake, cherry desserts. Dry, not sweet.
For fruitcake, hard sauce, flamb√©. VS or VSOP quality.
For berry desserts, chocolate pairings.
For peach desserts, fruit tarts.
Room temperature for baking. 1 large egg ‚âà 50g total, 30g white, 20g yolk.
Room temp for best volume when whipped. 1 white ‚âà 30g.
For custards, enriched doughs. 1 yolk ‚âà 20g.
Standard for baking. Room temperature preferred.
Substitute: 1 cup milk + 1 tbsp lemon juice, let stand 5 min.
For whipped cream, ganache. Doubles when whipped.
For moist cakes, coffee cakes. Full fat only for baking.
Philadelphia or similar. Room temp for frosting. 8 oz = 1 cup.
14 oz can standard. For fudge, magic bars, key lime pie.
12 oz can standard. For pumpkin pie, fudge.
Adds richness to bread. Carnation or similar.
Rumford or Clabber Girl. Check expiration - loses potency.
Arm & Hammer. Needs acid to activate. Check freshness.
Red Star or Fleischmann's. Proof in warm water first.
SAF-Instant or Fleischmann's RapidRise. No proofing needed.
Knox brand. 1 packet = 1 tbsp = sets 2 cups liquid.
For gluten-free baking. Use very small amounts.
Argo or Kingsford. For pie fillings, pastry cream.

ingredients.description: Dried egg white powder with stabilizers
ingredients.notes: Wilton. For royal icing without raw eggs.
Quaker. For oatmeal cookies, crumble toppings.
Finer cut than rolled. Can substitute in cookies.
Skippy or Jif for baking (contain stabilizers). Natural separates.
Lotus Biscoff or Trader Joe's. For frostings, fillings.
For fillings, frostings, swirled into brownies.
For whoopie pie filling, fudge. New England staple.
Libby's. NOT pumpkin pie filling. For pies, breads.
For moisture in cakes, fat replacement. Mott's natural.
None Such or homemade. For holiday pies and tarts.
For holiday bark, cookies, frosting. Wegmans or candy canes.
Americolor or Wilton. Much more potent than liquid.
Baker's Joy or Pam Baking. For coating pans.
